body_html:
That sounds wonderful and I hope the community finds it useful.

From what I understand, bazel is used to build libtensorflow_cc.so, and what's there packages that up with a set of header files.

Eventually, we would like to distribute the shared library and header files in a tarball that can be used by any build system, instead of having to maintain support for different build systems. We'd also like to tighten the API a bit, to reduce the number of internal header files that need to be exposed.

If anyone is interested in contributing to that, I'd suggest following along on #2412.
Thanks!

(FYI @skye)

body:
That sounds wonderful and I hope the community finds it useful.

From what I understand, [`bazel` is used](https://github.com/FloopCZ/tensorflow_cc/blob/master/tensorflow_cc/cmake/build_tensorflow.sh#L41) to build `libtensorflow_cc.so`, and what's there packages that up with a set of header files.

Eventually, we would like to distribute the shared library and header files in a tarball that can be used by any build system, instead of having to maintain support for different build systems. We'd also like to tighten the API a bit, to reduce the number of internal header files that need to be exposed.

If anyone is interested in contributing to that, I'd suggest following along on #2412.
Thanks!

(FYI @skye)
